Yippee!

Father finally agreed to let me go!

In September 1831, Darwin met with

Robert FitzRoy, captain of the Beagle.

I’m Captain FitzRoy.

It’s a pleasure to meet you.

Hmm, there’s already one naturalist on this boat…

On December 27, 1831, after numerous delays due to bad weather and boat repairs, the Beagle departed on its voyage at last.

but if Henslow recommends him, there’s not much I can do.

Captain?

Professor,

I’ll be sending

lots of animal and plant specimens,

so please store

them well.

No need

to worry about that. Have a

great trip!
